# The `TargetMachine` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Primary interface to the complete machine description for the target machine. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

Primary interface to the complete machine description for the target machine.

All target-specific information should be accessible through this interface.

Definition at line 77 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/target/targetmachine-h">TargetMachine.h</a>.

### addPassesToEmitFile() {#a16e27cb1cb4e03cb35f6eb7690d3e8ff}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual bool llvm::TargetMachine::addPassesToEmitFile (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/legacy/passmanagerbase">PassManagerBase</a> &amp;, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-pwrite-stream">raw&#95;pwrite&#95;stream</a> &amp;, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-pwrite-stream">raw&#95;pwrite&#95;stream</a> &#42;, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a73b761f8d40500a5a28889569526b260">CodeGenFileType</a>, bool, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinemoduleinfowrapperpass">MachineModuleInfoWrapperPass</a> &#42; MMIWP=nullptr)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Add passes to the specified pass manager to get the specified file emitted.

Typically this will involve several steps of code generation. This method should return true if emission of this file type is not supported, or false on success. <code>MMIWP</code> is an optional parameter that, if set to non-nullptr, will be used to set the MachineModuloInfo for this PM.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/target/targetmachine-h/#l00385">385</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/target/targetmachine-h">TargetMachine.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### addPassesToEmitMC() {#a8b157b36b2fc00d830a8b7d1546d746c}

<MemberDefinition

  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Add passes to the specified pass manager to get machine code emitted with the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcjit">MCJIT</a>.

This method returns true if machine code is not supported. It fills the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mccontext">MCContext</a> Ctx pointer which can be used to build custom <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcstreamer">MCStreamer</a>.

### usesPhysRegsForValues() {#a280c50132f28bb2f82be5f8c32d81406}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="virtual bool llvm::TargetMachine::usesPhysRegsForValues () const"
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
True if the target uses physical regs (as nearly all targets do).

False for stack machines such as <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/webassembly">WebAssembly</a> and other virtual-register machines. If true, all vregs must be allocated before PEI. If false, then callee-save register spilling and scavenging are not needed or used. If false, implicitly defined registers will still be assumed to be physical registers, except that variadic defs will be allocated vregs.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/target/targetmachine-h/#l00478">478</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/target/targetmachine-h">TargetMachine.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### useTLSDESC() {#a3b41be7605fb3c5d5485b6521aa561d9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool TargetMachine::useTLSDESC () const">
Returns true if this target uses TLS Descriptors.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/target/targetmachine-h/#l00251">251</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/target/targetmachine-h">TargetMachine.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/targetmachine-cpp/#l00236">236</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/targetmachine-cpp">TargetMachine.cpp</a>.

### DL {#a8c1d24a5ba7222c0f7ddce3a50a7a048}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="const DataLayout llvm::TargetMachine::DL"
  labels = {["protected"]}>
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> for the target: keep ABI type size and alignment.

The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> is created based on the string representation provided during construction. It is kept here only to avoid reparsing the string but should not really be used during compilation, because it has an internal cache that is context specific.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/target/targetmachine-h/#l00092">92</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/target/targetmachine-h">TargetMachine.h</a>.
